description: Students examine intellectual, political, social, and spiritual currents, 1300 to 1550,
particularly in the city of Florence, but also in broader Italian and European Renaissance
contexts.  Topics include humanism, the political life of the northern Italian city-states, changes
in spirituality and in the life of the church, the status of women, and the development of political
theory.  Readings include Petrarch, Machiavelli, and Erasmus.  Offered most years.
